# Autumn's Galactic Dance
## Scripture
"For since the creation of the world God’s invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse." - Romans 1:20

## Reflection
As the autumn season unfolds, the night sky transforms with it. The constellation of Pegasus, a majestic winged horse, becomes visible in the northern hemisphere, reminding us of the transient nature of life. Like the changing seasons, our lives are marked by phases of growth, decay, and transformation. Yet, amidst this flux, God's eternal power and divine nature remain a constant, a beacon of hope in the ever-shifting landscape of our lives.

The celestial ballet, with its choreographed dance of stars and planets, declares the glory of God's creation. As we gaze upon the starry expanse, we are invited to contemplate the infinite wisdom and power that underlies all of existence. In the grand tapestry of the universe, our lives are but a small, yet vital, thread, woven into the intricate pattern of God's design.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we marvel at the autumn sky, we are reminded of your eternal power and divine nature. Help us to see your hand at work in the ever-changing seasons of our lives. May we find comfort in your constant presence and guidance, and may our hearts be filled with wonder and awe at the beauty of your creation. Amen.
